But I want to ask him: do you still feel like lying on the floor, even now? Even after all this time, and after all these joys? Do you feel like lying on the floor, even now, and just becoming a Remembering Thing. That’s all I want to be sometimes. It’s all I can be sometimes. I just remember. I look back, at the love, and the fragility, and the ease, and the rightness of life then, and that’s all I am. A Remembering Thing.

But it’s impossible to be that way for long. Life calls you on; and life is good. You’re lying on the floor, and you notice that pound coin in the dust under the piano, and you fish it out. And you’re living again.

But there are still times now when I look with gratitude at my life, and I want to say, This is all very nice, This is all very lovely, I thank you all, I love you all. This is all very wonderful. But it isn’t home. It isn’t home.
